txt.en:
'Who are you?'

You tell the man and explain that Zidemel sent you.

'Zidemel found someone to help me with penance? Blessed are his words.

'Listen well, [placeholder]. I am Andur, the last of my bloodline. My brothers, sisters, and all their children are dead at the hands of the Ordâkhai. Zidemel said my family would live on if I gift a patch of the desert the blood of its sons and daughters mixed with mine.

'The desert sand-sifters to the south-east are the true daughters and sons of the desert. Collect drams of their blood that I may extend my lineage.'
You ventured into the desert and collected ten drams of sand-sifter blood for Andur. Return the blood to Andur at Jirush. He is listening to Zidemel preach in the centre of the outpost.
Zidemel asks you to assist his adherent, Andur. Andur wishes to extend his lineage. His family was all murdered by the Ordâkhai, and Zidemel told him of a way to live on.
Return the drams of sand-worm blood to Andur in Jirush

'The Ordâkhai took my family from the world. I will not die the last of my lineage. Please, [placeholder], help me. The sand-sifters gather in number south-east of Jirush. With their blood my lineage may live on.'

'I thank you for this gift, [placeholder]. I shall make my last trek into the desert and mix my blood and theirs. I will ensure my lineage does not pass into history with my death because of your actions this day.'
Zidemel the zealot told Andur his bloodline would live on if he provided the desert a hefty gift of blood. Andur asked that you collect the blood of sand-sifters so that he can fulfil this gift.
